definitions.definition: Able to be permeated ; absorbing or allowing the passage of fluids .
examples: Rainwater sinks through permeable rock to form an underground reservoir.

definitions.definition: Allowing the passage of persons , information , or other things, especially when such passage occurs despite hopes or expectations otherwise.

main_definition: Able to be permeated ; absorbing or allowing the passage of fluids .
secondary_definitions: ( by extension ) Allowing the passage of persons , information , or other things, especially when such passage occurs despite hopes or expectations otherwise.
